frame.name: Artifact
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Artifact</fen> is deliberately made or modified by an intelligent entity to be put to a certain kind of <fen>Use</fen>. Various properties of the <fen>Artifact</fen> may be specified, such as its <fen>Creator</fen>, <fen>Time_of_creation</fen>, <fen>Name</fen>, <fen>Type</fen>, and the <fen>Material</fen> of which it is composed. The <fen>Artifact</fen> may or may not be a physical entity.
<ex>There are reports that Kim Il Sung asked China to share its <fex name="Type">nuclear</fex> <fex name="Use">weapons</fex> <fex name="Artifact"><t>technology</t></fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Artifact
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the entity or substance that is designed to have a particular <fen>Use</fen>. This can refer to physical artifacts, like a mug or computer monitor, or a digital artifact, such as a website or document.</def-root>

FE.name: Use
FE.definition: <def-root>The use for which an artifact is intended.</def-root>

FE.name: Creator
FE.definition: <def-root>An individual or individuals that bring the <fen>Artifact</fen> into existence.</def-root>

FE.name: Time_of_creation
FE.definition: <def-root>The time at which an <fen>Artifact</fen> comes into existence.</def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition: <def-root>The term used to refer to an <fen>Artifact</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Material
FE.definition: <def-root>Any indication of what makes up the <fen>Artifact</fen>, including components, ingredients, etc.</def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE describes either a state or characteristic of the artifact which is not subsumed by the core FEs. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: wheel.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a circular object that revolves on an axle, fixed below a vehicle to enable it to move over the ground or forming part of a machine.

lexUnit.name: technology.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an abstract or physical product of human ingenuity focused on solving a problem

lexUnit.name: biotechnology.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the results of the exploitation of biological processes for industrial and other purposes, especially the genetic manipulation of micro-organisms for the production of antibiotics, hormones, etc.

lexUnit.name: artifact.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an object made by a human being.

lexUnit.name: control panel.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a usually flat surface containing switches, dials, buttons, etc. used to operate machinery

lexUnit.name: board.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A long, flat object manufactured for multipurpose use, generally made of wood or particle board and utilized in construction. Other kinds of boards include those for extreme sports, such as snowboards, etc.

lexUnit.name: board [game].n
lexUnit.definition: FN: A flat, portable surface patterned and designed for use in a game.

lexUnit.name: spatula.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an implement with a broad, flat, usually flexible blade, used for lifting, spreading, or stirring foods, paints, etc.

lexUnit.name: whisk.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an implement, usually a bunch of wire loops held together in a handle, for beating or whipping eggs, batter, etc.

lexUnit.name: tub.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a bathtub, used for bathing in

lexUnit.name: timer.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a device for indicating or measuring elapsed time (e.g. a stopwatch)

lexUnit.name: oven.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an enclosed heated compartment used for baking or roasting food, etc.

lexUnit.name: phone.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a telephone - an apparatus for transmission of sound or speech to a distant point, especially by an electric device
